scripts.dataset_stats module¶

dataset_stats.py is a script that collects statistics about datasets. It computes:

  • Mean, variance
  • Number of zero elements, nonzero elements, sparsity
  • Histogram of feature values, in steps of 0.01 (or specified by argument)
  • Histogram of average feature values, in steps of 0.01
  • Visualization of feature averages
  • Average feature correlation? Weighed by feature sums?
  • Direct visualization of a part of the dataset
class scripts.dataset_stats.DatasetStats(dataset, sample_n=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A simple container for various statistics about a dataset.

feature_histogram(feature, n_bins=None, whole_dataset=False)[source]¶

Plots the histogram of feature values and the mean. Does not include zero values, only gives their proportion.

feature_lecunn_covariances(n_items=1000)[source]¶

Computes and plots feature covariances, according to Y. LeCunn’s 1998 paper on efficient backprop.

Uses the first n_items data points.

item_histogram(idx, n_bins=None)[source]¶

Plots the cell value histogram directly from the dataset, taking the first N items.
